alert.note: Alert for Lee (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 12 at 10:44AM CST until January 12 at 5:00PM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO NOON CST SATURDAY... ...WIND CHILL WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, mixed precipitation changing to all snow with additional snow accumulations 1 to 3 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions with blowing snow expected tonight and Saturday morning. Northwest winds gusting as high as 50 mph by this evening. For the Wind Chill Watch, dangerously cold wind chills possible. Wind chills as low as 40 below zero. * WHERE...Lee County. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 5 PM CST this afternoon. For the Blizzard Warning, from 5 PM this afternoon to noon CST Saturday. For the Wind Chill Watch, from Saturday evening through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions today. Travel will become very difficult to impossible by tonight with significant blowing and drifting snow leading to occasional whiteout conditions. The hazardous conditions will impact the evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches, and lead to isolated power outages. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as ten minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Rain and possibly brief freezing rain will mix with snow at times through early afternoon, before cold air and strong winds move in changing the precipitation back to all snow. This evening, much colder air moves in which could result in a flash freeze on roadways.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
